results.title: South Africa: the white laager
results.creator_credit: Peter F. Davis, Barry Callaghan, Sveriges radio aktiebolag, United Nations Television, Villon Films and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: A documentary which explores the history of the Afrikaaners and Afrikaaner nationalism, and the development of apartheid and its relevance to South Africa’s political situation today. Includes interviews with whites in various professions and with differing points of view on apartheid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter F. Davis, Barry Callaghan, Sveriges radio aktiebolag, United Nations Television, Villon Films and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: Sound recording and reproduction
results.brief_description: Describes how sound is converted into light rays to produce optical sound motion pictures, and how the projector is able to change the light rays back into sound waves. Also describes sound recording by variable density.

results.creator_credit: Sandy Spillman, David Adams and Pyramid Films

results.creator_credit: James Wilhite, Pat Wilhite and Wilhite Productions

results.title: Song of the paddle
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bill Brand, Marrin Canell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Outdoorsman Bill Mason takes his wife and two children on a wilderness canoe camping holiday. In this film the art of canoeing is more than technical expertise; it becomes a family experience of shared joy. Along the way there are countless adventures and much lovely scenery, including the Indian rock carvings of Lake Superior

results.title: Song of Ceylon
results.creator_credit: Basil Wright, GPO Film Unit and John Grierson
results.brief_description: A poetic interpretation of the life and customs of the people of Ceylon, showing the contrast between the culture of the Singalese of the island, and the western economic outlook. One of the most famous of the GPO Film Unit’s productions, this film helped to build the reputation of the British documentary film movement. ‘The Song of Ceylon’ is in four sections, 1. The Buddha, 2. The Virgin island, 3. The Voice of commerce, 4. The Apparel of God. Sponsored by the Ceylon Tea Propaganda Board. Music by Walter Leigh. Photographed by Basil Wright.

results.title: Sonata in Brussels
results.brief_description: A portrait of life in a capital city. the noise of a crowd swarming around a city hotel is offset by the cooing of pigeons in the bird market; the mute dialogues in the parks, the clamour of the flea circus; the traffic jams, the whistle of the policeman which hypnotises the mannequins in a shop window; the cries of the street urchins; the music of the city. Without commentary.
results.description: A portrait of life in a capital city. the noise of a crowd swarming around a city hotel is offset by the cooing of pigeons in the bird market; the mute dialogues in the parks, the clamour of the flea circus; the traffic jams, the whistle of the policeman which hypnotises the mannequins in a shop window; the cries of the street urchins; the music of the city. Without commentary.

results.title: Something big in micro circuits
results.creator_credit: Tony Baker, G. Buckland-Smith, Film Producers Guild and Katrina Rank
results.brief_description: A detailed look at the vast field of the diminuitive. Animated sequences showing the various etching and photographic processes needed to produce transistors and other miniaturised equipment are described in detail.

results.title: The Mental hospital volunteer: someone who cares
results.brief_description: Depicts the role and influence of the mental hospital volunteer in the lives of hospitalised mental patients. Describes some of the undesirable conditions in mental hospitals, the needs of mental patients, the varied activities of a volunteer program, and the process of orienting and training new volunteers.

results.title: Soldiers in Sinai: a peacekeeping story
results.creator_credit: Pierre des Bonnet and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A basic film on the setting up of a UN Emergency Force - men flown to the Sinai Desert on short notice to take up positions between two opposing lines, for the peace keeping operation that followed in the wake of 1973 war in the Middle East. Shows how troops from many nations learn to work together as a unique international peace force.
